revised_title: William Stukeley and the Story of Newton's Apple Tree
tldr: This article discusses the historical significance of William Stukeley, an early Fellow of the Royal Society, and his connection to Isaac Newton. Stukeley preserved the story of how Newton's idea of gravitation came to him while observing an apple falling, and he also discovered the impact of ancient foundations on crop growth. The author highlights Stukeley's contributions to the history of the Royal Society and the preservation of Newton's legacy.
